page.title: 06LIFE-STYLES contd.
page.content: office."There was no means of transport to other towns,only by horseback,or by pony and trap.The children had to walk to the local school,where two teachers were employed.The children ranged from five to thirteen years of age,and there were only about forty children in the whole school.The school was eventually closed down,and the children were then sent to a school in Cutnall Green. Older children,to amuse themselves,played in the fields during the daytime,and then went to whistdrives and dances at night in the local village hall.There were no toilets at the hall,and they had to "relieve themselves" under the church wall. The farms in the area were mixed, both arable and dairy.There was,of
